abstract: Seven habits explain why Sheila C. Bair was effective as chairwoman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.
snippet: Seven habits explain why Sheila C. Bair was effective as chairwoman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.
lead_paragraph: The 2008 financial crisis revealed many of the world’s banking regulators to be woefully ineffective. Sheila C. Bair’s five years at the helm of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, which end on Friday, may offer a potential exception. A potted banking regulator’s version of the 1989 self-help book, “The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People,” sums up Ms. Bair’s tenure.

headline.main: Bair Has Been Effective Watchdog at F.D.I.C.
